intro: Bejaria boliviensis, commonly known as the Bolivian bejaria, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of Bolivia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic leaves and umbel-like inflorescences. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often in mountainous areas with cool climates. Its foliage is used in traditional medicine for its purported anti-inflammatory properties. Bejaria boliviensis is relatively rare and is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological adaptations.
